channel.title: Java Agents and Browser Applets
channel.description:
I think that Java agents are extremely cool. Good on frunk for exploring them and showing us all.
I say this, because you can load Java agents alongside your default browser applets. I am posting this because I think that not everybody realises the extreme power that java agents give us when it comes to easy of patching the client classes.
This is done in the Java configuration panel, found in Control Panel on Windows, shown working here: [img]http://img411.imageshack.us/img411/7397/configurefl6.png[/img]
And the wonderful result: [img]http://img405.imageshack.us/img405/1024/rsagentvh6.png[/img]
For the people about to insult me, I realise that the ability to do this, and the difficulty involved is extremely trivial. However, I urge everybody to try Java agents out asap, it is the answer to a lot of problems.
For more information, see frunk's thread [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,124319.0.html]here[/url], and silab's implementation [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,128284.0.html]here[/url].

@regecks1 wrote:

The point was that nobody grasped that you were able to start them alongside a browser applet, so I posted it again -.-’.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Agents and Browser Applets
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

regecks`:

I am posting this because I think that not everybody realises the extreme power that java agents give us when it comes to easy of patching the client classes.

Only adding this since I havent seen it posted.

To set the JVM to be able to redefine classes after they are loaded add “Can-Redefine-Classes: true” to the manifest with the agent.

Read full topic
